channel.title: Comments on: OS X Audio Source Tip

item.title: By: Mark Leusink
item.dc:creator: Mark Leusink
item.description: <p>I've only been using a Mac for about 4 days now and I'm already off to the advanced tips :-) This is very useful, thanks!</p>
item.content:encoded: I’ve only been using a Mac for about 4 days now and I’m already off to the advanced tips ðŸ™‚ This is very useful, thanks!

item.title: By: DavidLeedy
item.dc:creator: DavidLeedy
item.description:
<p>The Option Key makes additional options appear in a variety of places. Finder's "File" and "Go" come to mind along with the wireless icon in the menu bar. That shows signal strength and stuff. Also one I've used on occasion is if you are in the display preferences, and you hold down option BEFORE clicking on scaled, it'll give you many more resolution options to choose from then if you don't hold Option down.</p>
<p>Lots of tricks out there.</p>
item.content:encoded:
The Option Key makes additional options appear in a variety of places. Finder’s "File" and "Go" come to mind along with the wireless icon in the menu bar. That shows signal strength and stuff. Also one I’ve used on occasion is if you are in the display preferences, and you hold down option BEFORE clicking on scaled, it’ll give you many more resolution options to choose from then if you don’t hold Option down.

Lots of tricks out there.
